abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory
            and project sustainability is likely. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are assessed as satisfactory. Key
            lessons learned include the following: A credible
            privatization program requires a) a comprehensive
            communications program designed to reach all stakeholdersand
            to educate them on the policies, the program, and the use of
            the proceeds, particularlyvery early in project
            implementation and throughout project execution; b) a
            retrenchment and public enterprise debt policy that is
            carefully evaluated, planned, and implemented consistently;
            and c) increased technical capacity by contracting out to
            experienced consultants. The privatization strategy must be
            defined upfront and include measurable targets, modalities,
            and the roles of the various institutions and agencies
            involved to ensure an efficient, transparent process.
            Attracting sufficient high quality investors and operators
            and ensuring effective competition in the privatization
            process are possible only when a regulatory framework is in
            place and clearly spells out fair treatment of investors,
            reduces ability of the concerned parties to unilaterally
            undo commitments, and protects consumers from misuse on
            monopoly power. An effective civil service reform program
            requires overt and widely held political sponsorship,
            government commitment, sufficient capacity for change
            management, strong monitoring and evaluation, clear
            incentives, and sufficient funding for implementation.
